sn20.8:1.2: At one time the Buddha was staying near Vesālī, at the Great Wood, in the hall with the peaked roof.
sn20.8:1.3: There the Buddha addressed the mendicants,
sn20.8:2.1: “Mendicants, these days the Licchavis live using wood blocks as pillows, and they exercise diligently and keenly.
sn20.8:2.2: King Ajātasattu of Magadha, son of the princess of Videha, finds no vulnerability, he’s got no opportunity.
sn20.8:2.3: But in the future the Licchavis will become delicate, with soft and tender hands and feet.
sn20.8:2.4: They’ll sleep on soft beds with down pillows until the sun comes up.
sn20.8:2.5: King Ajātasattu of Magadha, son of the princess of Videha, will find a vulnerability and get an opportunity.
sn20.8:3.1: These days the mendicants live using wood blocks as pillows, and they meditate diligently and keenly.
sn20.8:3.2: Māra the Wicked finds no vulnerability, he’s got no opportunity.
sn20.8:3.3: But in the future the mendicants will become delicate, with soft and tender hands and feet.
sn20.8:3.4: They’ll sleep on soft beds with down pillows until the sun comes up.
sn20.8:3.5: Māra the Wicked will find a vulnerability and get an opportunity.
sn20.8:3.6: So you should train like this:
sn20.8:3.7: ‘We will live using wood blocks as pillows, and we will meditate diligently and keenly.’
